info.title: Rebilly Storefront REST API
info.description:
# Introduction
The Rebilly Storefront API is built on HTTP.  Our API is RESTful.  It has predictable
resource URLs.  It returns HTTP response codes to indicate errors.  It also
accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body. You can use your favorite
HTTP/REST library for your programming language to use Rebilly's Storefront API.

CustomerJWT.description:
You can create a JSON Web Token (JWT) via [Storefront Authentication](https://storefront-api-docs.rebilly.com/#operation/StorefrontPostLogin).
Usage format: `Bearer <JWT>`.

PublishableApiKey.description:
Only for the Tokens resource.
You can create a Publishable API Key via our [API Keys resource](https://user-api-docs.rebilly.com/#tag/API-Keys), by specifying the type as `publishable`.
PublishableApiKey.name: Authorization

ResourceId.description: The resource ID. Defaults to UUID v4.

country.description: The contact country ISO Alpha-2 code.

hash.description: A hash that can be used to compare multiple contacts for identical attribute values.

ResourceCustomFields.description: Custom Fields list as a map `{"custom field name": "custom field value", ...}`. The format must follow the saved format (see Custom Fields section for the formats).

ServerTimestamp.description: Read-only timestamp, automatically assigned on back-end.

paymentToken.description:
A write-only payment token; if supplied, it will be converted into a
payment instrument and be set as the `defaultPaymentInstrument`. The
value of this property will override the `defaultPaymentInstrument`
in the case that both are supplied. The token may only be used once
before it is expired.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

type.description: A URI reference [[RFC3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986)] that identifies the problem type. It should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type. When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

field.description: The field name. Dot notation is used for nested object field names.

type.description: If `variable` customers will be able to choose the quantity.
If `variable` customers will be able to choose the quantity.

plans.description: The list of plans that would be applied to customer order by default.

addonPlans.description:
The list of independent addons.
Customer will be able to select whether to add the plans from the list or not.

bumpPlans.description:
The list of plans that can be used instead of ones specified in `plans`.
Customer will be able to select whether to purchase bump plans or the regular ones.

accountsEnabled.description: If `true` customer will be able to sign-up and sign-in using the form.

couponsEnabled.description: If `true` customer will be able to use coupons on the form.

purchaseLimit.description: If the purchase limit is set â€“ every purchase will decrease it. Zero purchase limit will make form inactive.

paymentMethods.description:
The list of available payment methods. Only payment methods with at least one active gateway account are allowed.
If not specified all available payment methods will be displayed.

customization.description: Visual customization options for the form.

buttonText.description: You can use placeholder `{{amount}}` to substitute with the form total.

colors.description: Control the primary color used in the form and button text.

primary.description: Primary color for the form in hexadecimal format.

buttonText.description: Button text color for the form in hexadecimal format.

links.description: Various urls that appear on the form.

refundPolicy.description: The url to the website refund policy.

privacyPolicy.description: The url to the website privacy policy.

termsOfService.description: The url to the website terms of service.

googleAnalytics.description: The Google Analytics tracking identifier string.

googleTagManager.description: The Google Tag Manager tracking identifier string.

gtagJs.description: The Google Analytics tracking identifier string for Google's Global Site Tag (gtag.js) service.

facebookPixel.description: The Facebook Pixel tracking identifier string.

segmentAnalytics.description: The Segment Analytics tracking identifier string.

requiredAdditionalFields.description: The list of fields which are marked as required.

token.description: The session's token used for authentication.

CommonProduct.description:
Products include digital goods, services, and physical goods.
Products appear on invoice line items. If you set a tax category identifier,
taxes will be calculated upon invoice generation. If it is shippable,
shipping will be calculated upon invoice generation. Pricing and
variations are set within Plans.

unitLabel.description: The unit label, such as per `seat` or per `unit`.

requiresShipping.description: If the product requires shipping, shipping calculations will be applied.

options.description:
The product options such as color, size, etc. The product options definition does
not include option values. Those are defined within the plans.

taxCategoryId.description: The product's tax category identifier string.

formula.description:
The price formula determines what algorithm is used to calculate the invoice price based on a few factors,
- the quantity in the order (which may be variable if usage pricing, otherwise determined when creating the order)
- the price brackets data

To determine which formula is correct, please see the price formula documentation.

price.description:
For the very simple price when it's fixed and does not depend on the quantity chosen by customer.

If the price is 0, it's free.

Flat-rate pricing is represented in a simple price per unit.
Some examples:

- $30 per unit
- $0.10 per transaction
- $50 per period

If the price is 0, it's free.

maxQuantity.description: If the value is `null`, it''s assumed to be infinite.

brackets.description:
The price brackets, along with the price formula,
is used to calculate the amount to charge for the product on this plan on the invoice.

The "stairstep" example:

Price total | Max quantity | Description
------------|--------------|------------
$5          | 1            | 1
$13         | 5            | 2 to 5
$30         | null         | 6 or more

If someone bought 1 apple, it would be $5.

If someone bought 2 apples, it would be $13. For 2 to 5 apples, the price is $13 in any case.

price.description: If the price is 0, it is free.

maxQuantity.description:
If the value is `null`, it's assumed to be infinite.  It starts at the end of the previous bracket.
If there is no previous bracket, it starts at 1.

brackets.description:
The price brackets, along with the price formula,
is used to calculate the amount to charge for the product on this plan on the invoice.

The "tiered" example:

Price per apple | Max quantity | Description
----------------|--------------|------------
$5              | 1            | 1
$4              | 5            | 2 to 5
$3              | null         | 6 or more

If someone bought 1 apple, it would be $5.

If someone bought 2 apples, it would be $9. $5 per apple for the first apple, then $4 per apple for the 2nd to 5th apple.

price.description: If the price is 0, it is free.

maxQuantity.description:
If the value is `null`, it's assumed to be infinite.  It starts at the end of the previous bracket.
If there is no previous bracket, it starts at 1.

brackets.description:
The price brackets, along with the price formula,
is used to calculate the amount to charge for the product on this plan on the invoice.

The "volume" example:

Price per apple | Max quantity | Description
----------------|--------------|------------
$5              | 1            | 1
$4              | 5            | 2 to 5
$3              | null         | 6 or more

If someone bought 1 apple, it would be $5.

If someone bought 2 apples, it would be $8. For 2 to 5 apples, the price is $4 per apple.

price.description: If the price is 0, it is free.

maxQuantity.description:
If the value is `null`, it's assumed to be infinite.  It starts at the end of the previous bracket.
If there is no previous bracket, it starts at 1.

PlanBillingTiming.description:
The billing timing in relation to the service period.
For `prepaid` plans the customer pays when the service period starts,
whereas, for `postpaid` plans, the customer pays when the service period ends.

name.description: The plan name, displayed on invoices and receipts.

productOptions.description: Name-value pairs to specify the product options.

recurringInterval.description: The service interval. For a one-time item, use `null`.

limit.description:
The number of invoices this subscription order will generate
(if 1, it will not generate any beyond the initial order creation).
For example, set this property to `12`, when the `periodUnit` is month and the
`periodDuration` is 1, for a 1 year contract billed monthly.

trial.description: The trial. Set `null` if no trial.

price.description: The price of the trial. For a free trial, use `0`.

isTrialOnly.description: Whether a plan has a trial without recurring instructions.

setup.description: The setup. Set `null` if no setup.

price.description: The price of a setup - 0 is a valid value (for free).

revision.description:
Increments when the plan is modified. 
Compare to materialized subscription items revision.

IssueTimeShiftInstruction.description:
The calculation instruction of billing time.
This is used in conjunction with the **service period anchor** to calculate the time the invoice is issued.

chronology.description: The chronology of the billing time relatively to the service period start.

DueTimeShiftInstruction.description:
The calculation instruction of due time.
This is used in conjunction with the **billing anchor** to calculate due time of invoice.
The chronology of due time shift is always **after**.

InvoiceTimeShift.description:
The invoice time shift in conjunction with `billingTiming` allows to setup different billing use cases such as:
- Bill immediately when the service period _starts_
- Bill immediately after the service period _ends_
- Bill _interval of time_ before the service period _starts_
- Bill _interval of time_ after the service period _starts_
- Bill _interval of time_ before the service period _ends_
- Bill _interval of time_ after the service period _ends_
It allows to control the billing time.

invoiceTimeShift.description: You can shift issue time and due time of invoices for this plan.

periodNumber.description: Invoice item subscription order period number.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

amount.description: Total amount that was discounted by this Coupon.

invoiceNumber.description: An auto-incrementing number based on the sequence of invoices for any particular customer.

subscriptionId.description: The related order's ID if available, otherwise null.

poNumber.description: Purchase order number which will be displayed on the invoice.

notes.description: Notes for the customer which will be displayed on the invoice.

delinquentCollectionPeriod.description: Delinquent collection period - difference between paidTime and dueTime in days.

collectionPeriod.description: Collection period - difference between paidTime and issuedTime in days.

paymentFormUrl.description:
URL where the customer can be redirected to pay for the invoice
with one of the methods which are available for this customer.
It's an alternative to creating a new transaction with empty `methods`.

enrolled.description: Is the cardholder enrolled in 3D Secure.

isDowngraded.description: If 3D Secure 2 was attempted but downgraded to 3D Secure 1.

purchaseAmount.description: The amount actually purchased which may have differed from the originally requested amount in case of an adjustment.

requestAmount.description: The amount in the payment request. If adjusted, the purchase amount and billing amount may vary from it.

invoiceIds.description: The invoice IDs related to transaction.

subscriptionIds.description: The orders IDs related to transaction's invoice(s).

planIds.description: The plan IDs related to transaction's order(s).

redirectUrl.description: The URL to redirect the end-user when an offsite transaction is completed. Defaults to the website's configured URL.

retryNumber.description: The position in the sequence of retries.

isRetry.description: True if this transaction is retry.

billingDescriptor.description:
The billing descriptor that appears on the periodic billing statement. Commonly
12 or fewer characters for a credit card statement.

requestId.description: The transaction's request ID.  This ID must be unique within a 24 hour period. Use this field to prevent duplicated transactions.

hasAmountAdjustment.description: True if transaction has amount adjustment.

gatewayName.description: Payment Gateway name, available only after the gateway is selected for the transaction.

approvalUrl.description: The URL to redirect the end-customer when transaction `status` is `waiting-approval` or `offsite`.

documentType.description: Document type submitted for validation, only identity-proof type is analyzed in an automated manner.

matchLevel.description: The level of strictness for the document matches.

reviewTime.description: Date and time of manual review.

token.description: The session's token used for authentication.

expiredTime.description: Session expired time. Defaults to one hour.

BrowserData.title: Browser data
BrowserData.description: Browser data used for 3DS and risk scoring.

colorDepth.description: The browser's color depth in bits per pixel obtained using the `screen.colorDepth` property.

isJavaEnabled.description: Whether Java is enabled in a browser or not. Value is returned from the `navigator.javaEnabled` property.

language.description: The browser's language settings returned from the `navigator.language` property.

screenWidth.description: The browser's screen width returned from the `screen.width` property.

screenHeight.description: The browser's screen height returned from the `screen.height` property.

timeZoneOffset.description:
The browser's time zone offset in minutes from UTC.
A positive offset indicates the local time is behind UTC, and negative is ahead.
Can find it with `(new Date()).getTimezoneOffset()` property.

RiskMetadata.title: Risk metadata
RiskMetadata.description: Risk metadata used for 3DS and risk scoring.

isProxy.description: True if customer's ip address is related to proxy.

isVpn.description: True if customer's ip address is related to VPN.

isTor.description: True if customer's ip address is related to TOR.

isHosting.description: True if customer's ip address is related to hosting.

isp.description: Internet Service Provider name, if available.

country.description: Country ISO Alpha-2 code for specified ipAddress.

distance.description: Distance between IP Address and Billing Address geolocation (kilometers).

hasMismatchedBillingAddressCountry.description: True if the billing address country and geo-IP address are not the same.

hasMismatchedBankCountry.description: True if the bank country and geo-IP address are not the same.

hasMismatchedTimeZone.description: True if the browser time zone and IP address associated time zone are not the same.

hasMismatchedHolderName.description: True if the customer's name from billing address and from customer's primary address are not the same.

paymentInstrumentVelocity.description: Number of transactions for this payment instrument (based on fingerprint) in the last 24 hours.

deviceVelocity.description: Number of transactions for this device (based on fingerprint) in the last 24 hours.

score.description: Risk score computed per all the factors.

status.description:
Payment instrument status. When an instrument is `active` it means it has been used at least once for an approved transaction.
To remove an instrument from being in use, set it as `deactivated` (see the deactivation endpoint).

fingerprint.description: A unique value to identify the payment instrument regardless of variable values. It contains alphanumeric values.

bin.description: The card's bin (the PAN's first 6 digits).

accountNumberType.description: Bank's account number type. A valid value is basic bank account number (BBAN) or international bank account number (IBAN).

fingerprint.description: A unique value to identify the bank account. It contains alphanumeric values.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the bank account.

methods.description:
The list of available payment methods.
Only payment methods with at least one active gateway account are allowed.

If not specified all available payment methods will be displayed.

Customer can choose any of those as well as the payment instrument for them.
Additional steps will occur via a redirect to `approvalUrl`.

quantity.description: Number of units of the product on the given plan.

paymentInstruction.description: The payment instruction to be used for purchasing.

couponIds.description: The list of coupons applied to the order.

password.description: If set would be used to create customer account.

quantity.description: Number of units of the product on the given plan.

couponIds.description: The list of coupons applied to the order.

amount.description: Total amount that was discounted by this coupon.

quantity.description: Number of units of the product on the given plan.

feature.description: The specific feature (eg. digital wallet or a processor) of this method. If method doesn't have any features â€“ will be null.

filters.description:
For the method to be applicable any of the following filters should match.
If no filters sent â€“ no restrictions applied. This follows our standard filter format.

feature.description: The specific feature (eg. digital wallet or a processor) of this method. If method doesn't have any features â€“ will be null.

filters.description:
For the method to be applicable any of the following filters should match.
If no filters sent â€“ no restrictions applied. This follows our standard filter format.

For the method to be applicable any of the following filters should match.
If no filters sent â€“ no restrictions applied. This follows our standard filter format.

subAffiliate.description: Lead source sub-affiliate also called a sub-id or click id in some circles (eg 123456).

salesAgent.description: Lead source sales agent (eg James Bond).

clickId.description: Lead source click id (may come from an ad server).

servicePhone.description: The website customer service phone number.

serviceEmail.description: The website customer service email address.

organizationId.name: Organization-Id
organizationId.description: Organization identifier in scope of which need to perform request (if not specified, the default organization will be used).

collectionFilter.name: filter
collectionFilter.description:
The collection items filter requires a special format.
Use "," for multiple allowed values.  Use ";" for multiple fields.
See the [filter guide](https://api-reference.rebilly.com/#section/Using-filter-with-collections) for more options and examples about this format.

collectionQuery.name: q
collectionQuery.description: The partial search of the text fields.

collectionSort.name: sort
collectionSort.description: The collection items sort field and order (prefix with "-" for descending sort).

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized access, invalid credentials was used.

currentPassword.description: Current password - used when requesting password change.

newPassword.description: New password - used when requesting password change.

billingAddress.description: The billing address (if supplied â€“ overrides billing address from token).

paymentToken.description:
A write-only payment token; if supplied, it will be converted into a
payment instrument and be set as the `defaultPaymentInstrument`. The
value of this property will override the `defaultPaymentInstrument`
in the case that both are supplied. The token may only be used once
before it is expired.

post.description: Sends an email with a link containing a token to reset user password.

get.description: Retrieve a checkout form with specified identifier string.
Retrieve a invoice with specified ID.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of KYC documents
get.description: Retrieve a list of KYC documents.

200.description: A list of KYC documents was retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieve a KYC document with specified ID.

patch.description: Update a KYC document with predefined ID.

post.summary: Create a session with username and password
post.description: Create a session with username and password.

Perform a payment for a transaction or an invoice.

If Customer JWT contains `transactionId` or `invoiceId` it will be used instead. `transactionId` has a higher
priority than `invoiceId`.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of Payment Instruments
get.description: Retrieve a list of payment instruments.

200.description: A list of payment instrument was retrieved successfully.

post.description:
Create a payment instrument.

The only way to create a payment instrument is using a payment instrument
token pre-created via [FramePay](https://rebilly.github.io/framepay-docs/).

get.description: Retrieve a payment instrument by ID.

patch.description:
Update any of the payment instrument's values.

Use Framepay payment token to update desired values.

200.description: A list of plans was retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieve a plan with specified ID.

200.description: A list of products was retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieve a product with specified ID.

post.description:
Purchase can be accomplished both with and without Authentication.
Purchase via pre-created Payment Instrument is only available with Authentication.
Use purchase preview before making an actual purchase.

Purchase can be accomplished both with and without Authentication.
Purchase via pre-created Payment Instrument is only available with Authentication.
Use purchase preview before making an actual purchase.

Get available payment methods for a specific transaction or a purchase.

The payment methods order shown to a customer **SHOULD** be the same as the order in the response.

The list of available methods is generated from available [Gateway Accounts](https://user-api-docs.rebilly.com/tag/Gateway-Accounts)
intersected with the last matched [Rules Engine](https://user-api-docs.rebilly.com/tag/Rules#operation/PutEventRule)
`adjust-ready-to-pay` action on `ready-to-pay-requested` event.

If there were no actions matched for the specific request â€“ all methods supported by the Gateway Accounts are sent.

To invert this behavior â€“ place an all-matching rule at the very end of the `ready-to-pay-requested` event in
Rules Engine with an empty `paymentMethods` property of the `adjust-ready-to-pay` action.

If Ready to Pay is used with Transaction-scoped JWT all fields will be ignored except the `riskMetadata`.

get.description: Retrieve a transaction with specified ID.
Retrieve a website. Use it to find the website name, logo, or more.
